snippet: Members of a Chatham, N.J., softball team hope to stay friends, keep their jobs and, well, see the Giants win.
abstract: Members of a Chatham, N.J., softball team hope to stay friends, keep their jobs and, well, see the Giants win.
lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago, if the Giants were headed to Green Bay to play the Packers in the playoffs, fans in New York might have considered themselves lucky to catch the game on television. Today, with tickets available online and frequent-flier miles accruing with every credit-card purchase, fans can dare to dream a little more boldly. Six members of a Chatham, N.J., softball team - a mix of lawyers, Wall Streeters and computer software salesmen - are set to travel to Lambeau Field for Sunday's showdown between the Giants and the Packers. It will be a trip of cheap hotels and high hopes, cramped rental cars and unexpectedly good seats at the game. The men - they will be joined by two pals in Milwaukee - have agreed to create a Titletown travelogue. Their hopes are to stay friends, keep their jobs and, well, see the Giants win.

headline.main: Eight Men In: A Trip to Lambeau
